Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: This was a great little bar to stop by just outside of the Heineken factory. The pizza far exceeded my expectations for just a quick bite. Drink and food selection was pretty good. I recommend doing the extra cold Heineken. The servers/bartenders were friendly, and quick to anything you needed. Recommend!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text:
Had a great meal here.
Unfortunately the lady serving the customers is not exactly friendly and helpful, but the cooker not only did a a great job preparing our  food, but also was ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: I was recommended this place by another tourist and I decided to check it out and it was worth it. Their bitterballs (which I was told to specifically try) were delicious. They are very hot as well so be careful. The server was absolutely joy to talk to, very warm and welcoming.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Excellent place to have lunch. Located next to a very busy intersection near Heineken brewery. With large windows that provides a great entertainment to look out while having food. The food is of top quality. We had the teriyaki chicken ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: I grab a quick bite with my girlfriend and it was really good. The staff is kind and the environment remember the irish pub (without the live performance, of course). The food was really tasty and not that expensive. The chips/fries are a must in here

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: First time having Heineken in Amsterdam and it was smooth...also tried a beer that‚Äôs made by Heineken called Zwaar Blond which I recommend as well...I was here on a Sunday night at about 9pm and it was pretty empty...so if you‚Äôre looking ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Good friendly place. Good food to set you up for the day!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: We‚Äôve been coming to this places few days for the last month and we really like it. Good music and atmosphere. Probably our favourite caf√© in Amsterdam.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: I went to this cafe and restaurant two times in one day. Morning I went there and have a good cappuccino the. Visit vangogh and Rijksmuseum then afternoon we had lunch there which was absolutely perfect. It is in front of Heineken museum ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Cosy vibe, friendly staff and relaxing atmosphere! Portions are massive and good value for money

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: The hummus sandwich was absolutely delicious!! And cheap.. around 7 euros if I'm not mistaken.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text:
We stopped here for a drink and some lunch whilst in Amsterdam
The food was amazing the staff where lovely

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Nice place to chill and eat good burger!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Stopped in here before going to the Heineken tour, which is just across the road. Very busy and vibrant place with a good atmosphere. We only had a coffee as we were just killing time. A lot of people having breakfast, and the food looked ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Tasty food, great atmosphire, great staff!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Very good beer and omlet for breakfast.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Stayed in Amsterdam a week and came here three times. Once for a delicious breakfast and twice in the evening for a casual beer. The staff are super friendly and it's really a very nice place to pop in for something quick. Very quiet in the evenings so great place to chill and talk.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Surprising find for breakfast - went to it as the queue for its popular neighbour, B&R, was frankly quite frightening considering our hunger at that point in time. ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: We stopped in for a quick bite after a late Heineken factory tour (and the two beers afterward!) and were blown away.  The waiter was very friendly and attentive despite the late hour and the food (tuna melt and open-face hummus sandwich) was fantastic.  Great ending to a wonderful day!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: This is a really great bar for anyone to visit, any time.  Really comfortable, great service, just the kind of place you are looking for when you travel: a big old brown wood bar, brown wood floor, some wood paneling on the walls, and some ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Probably my own fault for ordering nachos at a Dutch cafe, but they were not great. They gave us Thai chili sauce instead of salsa, which was weird. Other than the lackluster nachos, the bar has a great, cozy vibe and the beer is excellent.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Good.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: We stopped in for dinner and drinks after a long day of sight seeing. We requested tap water with our dinner and beers and were refused. They flat out lied and told us it was against the law. Food was good, but beware of this place.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Im on a trip with a couple friends travelling all around Europe. We went there yesterday in our search for some food before our Heineken experience. I started talking to the man at the counter when he suddenly started accusing me of ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Lovely little place, good and friendly service. Also ive seen this beautiful girl, sitting with her grandmom,, as i walked out to go on a heiniken tour we shared a look and a smile, she had big beautiful eyes, short hair and a hipster style. Dont judge me for this shot in the dark here, but if anyone knows her, help a guy outüòÇ ‚òÆÔ∏è

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text:
Where: Caf√© Berkhout - Amsterdam
What: A restaurant in front of Heineken
How was it:  It seems to be popular amongst the locals.  We arrived late ‚Ä¶

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: We got the fries, pizza of the day, homemade tomato soup and a couple drinks. The food is simple but well made! And the tomato soup definitely tastes homemade

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: This was a great little spot for lunch. The staff were friendly and the food was of great quality for a good price. Would highly recommend having lunch here before heading over to the Heineken Brewery.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Loved the meatballs, unique taste.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: How can you possibly rate this place with 4.4 stars? 45 mins for 2 burgers? A disappearing waiter? 20 minutes to get somebody to settle the check? Caf√© Bad seems like a better name.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Very nice place. A little bit noisy but the atmosphere inside makes it very cosy. Drinks are decent and the food selection is pretty big. From sandwiches to burgers and more. Enjoy!

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Nice room. Good beers. Soup is good.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text:
Food was good but the waitress was very very rude. Why would she work if she is so indifferent and lazy and has a bad attitude. She has a problem.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Nice bar, typical Dutch old-style pub, relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff. They play football matches on the beamer when Ajax (Amsterdam football club) plays :)

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Great burgers, atmosphere and nice staff :)

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Great staff and tasty apple pie !

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Was here a number of years ago and decided to visit again when I was recently in Amsterdam. Really nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and the burgers are top notch. Great coffee too.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Really nice place to stay in front of the Heineken brewery. Perfect service and very friendly!!!would go there any time. Cheers

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Excellent Service! Decent prices, also for the Fingerfoods ;)

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Nice spot for a beer and to watch the world go by. As it's opposite the Heineken brewery they encourage ordering pints rather than 'girls' small beers.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Your home away from home brown cafe üòç

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: The service was great and so was the food. Stopped in after the Heineken experience before doing the canal tour and really enjoyed it.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: This is a typical brown cafe in Amsterdam and regular hangout joint for Heineken staff. It is really 'gezellig' and worth your while if you want to hang out or have a beer. Have a Heineken though ;)

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text:
Very good place to have good dinner (soup and sanwiches) while drinking a good beer. Coffee is good too.
Staff is kind and professional.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Great speciality burgers when my wife & I visited back in June. Ambiance was laid back and we felt very comfortable hanging out in there, enjoying some great beers.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Disgusting place. We were waiting for 20 minutes and the waiter didn't ask us what we want, after that and with waiters angers face, we go out from the cafe. No drink, no lunch. Really disgusting and unpleasant.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Great food, I went for breakfast although they also have soup, salad, beer and more. Reasonable prices. Right across the train station.

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Great soup, bread and pizza.. which was perfect in the cold Amsterdam weather. The service was good too..

Name: Cafe Berkhout
Review Text: Nice and tiny little Bar

Review Text: Really good food, nice staff, good value, free WiFi. Good for a bite to eat before the beer drinking at the Heineken Experience next door!

Review Text: Small and cosy. They have fantastic burgers, and a brilliant atmosphere. Fridays are packed!
